Major_Arcs.title: Circus Introduction and Initial Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of the circus, the character of Paul Bunyan, and the initial conflict with Matto Grasso, establishing the early narrative elements and characters.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Introduction of Paul Bunyan
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Paul Bunyan as the circus strongman and shows the town's reaction to the circus arriving.

narrative_arcs.title: Man Hears News of the Circus
Family Reacts to Giraffe at Circus

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Revelation of Identity
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the man in checkered shirt intervening in a tent dispute, displaying unexpected strength and revealing himself as Paul Bunyan.

narrative_arcs.title: Pistol Threat and Revelation of Identity

sub_scenes.title: Offer and Acceptance to Join the Circus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the aftermath of the fight, the circus owner's gratitude, and the offer to Paul Bunyan to become the circus's strongman, which he accepts.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Revelation of Past Conflict

Major_Arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Revenge and Thwarted Plans
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Matto Grasso's attempts to sabotage Paul Bunyan's circus performance and Paul Bunyan's interventions to save the day, highlighting the ongoing conflict and Paul's heroic actions.

sub_scenes.title: Paul Bunyan's Debut and Matto Grasso's Plot
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Paul Bunyan's successful circus debut and Matto Grasso's envious reaction and plan for revenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Debut and Matto Grasso's Envy
Circus Tent Fire and Paul Bunyan's Swift Action

sub_scenes.title: Ape Release Scheme and Foiled Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Matto Grasso's second revenge scheme involving releasing an ape, and Paul Bunyan's quick intervention to stop it.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Frustration and a New Scheme
The Ape's Release and Paul's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Failed Attempts to Evade Capture
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the ape releaser's desperate and comical attempts to escape capture within the circus arena.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Arena and a New Plan
The Hat Trick and Continued Escape

sub_scenes.title: Impromptu Fight and Circus Spectacle
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts an unexpected fight breaking out during the circus, turning into an unscheduled spectacle for the audience.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution, Reward, and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the circus conflict with Paul Bunyan's heroic act, his refusal of the strongman position, and his departure.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Adventures: Ogress of Tibet and Princess Lotus
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's separate adventures, including an encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet and his quest to help the King of Hi-Toun find his missing daughter, Princess Lotus.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Marco Polo's Exploits
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Marco Polo and hints at his adventurous past, specifically mentioning a confrontation with the Awful Ogress of Tibet.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet

sub_scenes.title: Discovery of the Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts focus to a new character and location, where a man on horseback discovers a talking severed head in a forest.

sub_scenes.title: Gratitude and Direction from the Old Man
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Marco Polo helping an old man and receiving a dagger and directions to Hi-Toun and Princess Lotus as a reward.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Guidance from the Old Man

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Mourning Hi-Toun
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Marco Polo arriving at Hi-Toun and discovering the city is in mourning due to the King's grief.

sub_scenes.title: Welcome and Mission Request in Hi-Toun
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Marco Polo's welcome by the King of Hi-Toun and the King's request for help in finding his missing daughter, Princess Lotus.

narrative_arcs.title: The King's Grief Over Daughter Lotus's Disappearance

sub_scenes.title: Encounter with the Ogress in Disguise
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Marco Polo encountering the Ogress in disguise as a distressed woman, leading him into a trap.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with a Starving Woman and the Witch's Castle
Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Imprisonment as a 'Guest' and Ogress Revelation
Confrontation with Tusked Mice and Ogress's Claws

sub_scenes.title: Escape from the Ogress and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene appears to shift to a different narrative involving escape from captivity and a reunion, potentially related to the 'Fly Blade' mentioned earlier but distinct from the Ogress encounter which is unresolved.

narrative_arcs.title: The Unexpected Attack and Its Success
Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of buried treasure, betrayal, and long-awaited revenge, narrated by a Treasure Keeper and set in a British penal colony and England.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Keeper's Prologue and Penal Colony Setup
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the Treasure Keeper who sets the stage for a story of treasure, and then shifts to a British penal colony to introduce the setting and characters.

narrative_arcs.title: Penal Colony Routine and Officer's Request

sub_scenes.title: Desperate Plea and Treasure Proposition
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a prisoner's urgent attempt to speak with Captain Brooking and his offer of treasure in exchange for escape.

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal, Revenge Vow, and Years Passing
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the prisoner realizing he's been betrayed, vowing revenge, and then shows the passage of years until his release.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
Years Later - Freedom and Undying Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Deceptive Invitation in England
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Joseph Jordan tracking down Captain Brooking in England, confronting him, and being deceptively invited to Brooking's home.

sub_scenes.title: Attic Betrayal and Murder
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the deceptive invitation leading to an attic where betrayal and murder occur over the treasure.

sub_scenes.title: Police Investigation and Moral Conclusion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the police investigation into the murder and concludes with a moral reflection by an old man about the nature of treasure.

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Place and Salvation through Forgiveness
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a supernatural mystery at Matthews Place, involving a haunting, Dr. Styx, and a quest for salvation through forgiveness and brotherly love.

sub_scenes.title: Dr. Styx and Courtroom Drama
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dr. Styx in a menacing scene and then shifts to a courtroom where Vincent Matthews is sentenced for murder, setting up the context for the haunted estate.

sub_scenes.title: Discussion of Haunting and Arrival at Matthews Place
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Mr. Northrup and Dr. Styx discussing the haunted Matthews estate and Mr. Northrup's arrival at the location.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Matthews' Estate and Haunting

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Mr. Northrup ignoring warnings and entering the haunted house, immediately encountering Vincent Matthews' ghost.

narrative_arcs.title: Ignoring Alvin's Warning and Entering the House

sub_scenes.title: Physical Fight and Ghost's Guidance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows a physical confrontation between Mr. Northrup and the ghost, followed by a dialogue where the ghost offers guidance on salvation.

narrative_arcs.title: Seeking Guidance and Receiving Advice on Salvation
Revelation of Rosalind as the Key to Salvation

sub_scenes.title: Summoning Rosalind and Achieving Rest
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene culminates in the summoning of Rosalind, the act of forgiveness, and the brothers' reconciliation, leading to peace for the spirits.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Confrontation and Accusation of Cowardice
Physical Restraint and Assertion of Superior Strength
Accusation and Identification of the Destroyer
Request for a Favor: Permitting Rest
Acceptance of Brotherly Love and Release
Vincent's Remorse and Rosalind's Ultimate Forgiveness

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Voyages and Mutiny
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc narrates the historical voyages of Henry Hudson in search of the Northwest Passage, detailing his expeditions, crew discontent, and the tragic mutiny that led to his abandonment.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Henry Hudson's Fate and First Voyage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the historical mystery of Henry Hudson's disappearance and then shifts to Amsterdam to depict the proposal for his first voyage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Mysterious Fate of Henry Hudson

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage Disappointment and Return
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene narrates the growing discontent on Hudson's first voyage, the exploration of the Hudson River leading to disappointment, and the eventual return to Holland.

narrative_arcs.title: Growing Discontent and Demand to Turn South
Entering the Hudson River and False Hope
Hudson's Resignation and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage, Icy Conditions, and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hudson's second voyage, the ship getting stuck in ice, growing crew dissatisfaction, and the eventual eruption of mutiny.

narrative_arcs.title: Hudson's Second Expedition and Icy Route
Resumption of Voyage and Crew's Grievances

Major_Arcs.title: The Arabian Knight and the Rescue Mission
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the Arabian Knight, Hassan, on a mission to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen, showcasing his bravery and skill.

sub_scenes.title: Chase and Mission Briefing
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with a chase and then shifts to Hassan being summoned by the Caliph and briefed on his mission to rescue a kidnapped woman.

narrative_arcs.title: The Arabian Knight Introduction and Chase
Summoned by the Caliph and The Mission Briefing

sub_scenes.title: Setting Out and Tracking the Tartars
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hassan embarking on his mission, reaching a deserted oasis, and finding the Tartars' trail.

narrative_arcs.title: The Deserted Oasis and Tracking the Tartars
Encounter and Warning from a Traveler
Revealing the Rescue and Parting Ways

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Contacting the Captive
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Hassan reaching the Tartar camp, subduing a sentry, infiltrating the camp in disguise, and making contact with the captive woman.

sub_scenes.title: Capture, Trial by Combat, and Victory
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hassan being discovered and captured, his confrontation with Kurgan, the trial by combat, and his eventual victory.

narrative_arcs.title: Kurgan's Recognition and Grant of Safe Passage

sub_scenes.title: Farewell and Journey's End with Romance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the Arabian Knight's tale with Kurgan's honorable farewell, a moment of romantic tension between Hassan and the rescued woman, and their affectionate goodbye as they reach Bagdad.
